explain: The aspect states that the fiery sunsets in Washington were caused by wildfires in Siberia. This suggests that the wildfires in Siberia, which started on April 14, are influencing sunsets in Washington due to the smoke they are producing, contributing to the more vibrant and dramatic hues in the sky.

The fires in Southeastern Siberia, which started on April 14, have led to vast destruction of villages in the area. The smoke from the fires heavily impacted the region, causing the sunsets to appear with the blended colors due to the smoke particles filtering out other colors.

Seattle native Tim Durkan shared photos of the amber-colored sunsets, which most likely resulted from the massive wildfires in Southeastern Siberia that were caused on April 14 and rapidly grew out of control, eventually leading to destroyed dozens of villages in the region. The amber-colored sunsets are a visual indication of the impacts of these devastating fires.
